trans-unit.source: Using Custom Script Extension Azure Resource Manager Templates
trans-unit.target: Using Custom Script Extension Azure Resource Manager Templates

trans-unit.source: Automating Azure Virtual Machine configuration tasks using Custom script with ARM Templates
trans-unit.target: Automating Azure Virtual Machine configuration tasks using Custom script with ARM Templates

trans-unit.source: Using Custom Script Extension With Azure Resource Manager Templates
trans-unit.target: Using Custom Script Extension With Azure Resource Manager Templates

trans-unit.source: This article gives an overview of writing Azure Resource Manager Templates with Custom Script Extension for bootstrapping workloads on a Linux or a Windows VM.
trans-unit.target: This article gives an overview of writing Azure Resource Manager Templates with Custom Script Extension for bootstrapping workloads on a Linux or a Windows VM.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of Custom Script Extension please refer to the article here.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of Custom Script Extension please refer to the article here.

trans-unit.source: Ever since its launch, Custom Script Extension has been used widely to configure workloads on both Windows and Linux VMs.
trans-unit.target: Ever since its launch, Custom Script Extension has been used widely to configure workloads on both Windows and Linux VMs.

trans-unit.source: With the introduction of Azure Resource Manager Templates, users can now create a single template that not only provisions the VM but also configures the workloads on it.
trans-unit.target: With the introduction of Azure Resource Manager Templates, users can now create a single template that not only provisions the VM but also configures the workloads on it.

trans-unit.source: Overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates.
trans-unit.target: Overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager Template allow you to declaratively specify the Azure IaaS infrastructure in Json language by defining the dependencies between resources.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Template allow you to declaratively specify the Azure IaaS infrastructure in Json language by defining the dependencies between resources.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates, please refer to the articles below:
trans-unit.target: For a detailed overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates, please refer to the articles below:

trans-unit.source: Resource Group Overview.
trans-unit.target: Resource Group Overview.

trans-unit.source: Deploying Templates with Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Deploying Templates with Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Deploying Templates with Azure Powershell.
trans-unit.target: Deploying Templates with Azure Powershell.

trans-unit.source: Pre-Requistes for running Custom Script Extension
trans-unit.target: Pre-Requistes for running Custom Script Extension

trans-unit.source: Install the latest Azure PowerShell Cmdlets or Azure CLI from here.
trans-unit.target: Install the latest Azure PowerShell Cmdlets or Azure CLI from here.

trans-unit.source: If the scripts will be run on an existing VM, make sure VM Agent is enabled on the VM, if not follow this article to install one.
trans-unit.target: If the scripts will be run on an existing VM, make sure VM Agent is enabled on the VM, if not follow this article to install one.

trans-unit.source: Upload the scripts that you want to run on the VM to Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Upload the scripts that you want to run on the VM to Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: The scripts can come from a single or multiple storage containers.
trans-unit.target: The scripts can come from a single or multiple storage containers.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively the scripts can also be uploaded to a Github account.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively the scripts can also be uploaded to a Github account.

trans-unit.source: The script should be authored in such a way that the entry script which is launched by the extension in turn launches other scripts.
trans-unit.target: The script should be authored in such a way that the entry script which is launched by the extension in turn launches other scripts.

trans-unit.source: Overview of using Custom Script Extension with Templates:
trans-unit.target: Overview of using Custom Script Extension with Templates:

trans-unit.source: For deploying with templates we use the same version of Custom Script extension thats availale for Azure Service Management APIs.
trans-unit.target: For deploying with templates we use the same version of Custom Script extension thats availale for Azure Service Management APIs.

trans-unit.source: The extension supports the same parameters and scenarios like uploading files to Azure Storage account or Github location.
trans-unit.target: The extension supports the same parameters and scenarios like uploading files to Azure Storage account or Github location.

trans-unit.source: The key difference while using with templates is the exact version of the extension should be specified, as opposed to specifying the version in majorversion.* format.
trans-unit.target: The key difference while using with templates is the exact version of the extension should be specified, as opposed to specifying the version in majorversion.* format.

trans-unit.source: Template Snippet for Custom Script Extension on a Linux VM
trans-unit.target: Template Snippet for Custom Script Extension on a Linux VM

trans-unit.source: Define the following extension resource in the Resource section of the template
trans-unit.target: Define the following extension resource in the Resource section of the template

trans-unit.source: Template Snippet for Custom Script Extension on a Windows VM
trans-unit.target: Template Snippet for Custom Script Extension on a Windows VM

trans-unit.source: Define the following resource in the Resource section of the template
trans-unit.target: Define the following resource in the Resource section of the template

trans-unit.source: In the examples above, replace the file URL and the file name with your own settings.
trans-unit.target: In the examples above, replace the file URL and the file name with your own settings.

trans-unit.source: After authoring the template, you cna deploy them using Azure CLI or Azure Powershell.
trans-unit.target: After authoring the template, you cna deploy them using Azure CLI or Azure Powershell.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the examples below for complete samples of configuring applications on a VM using custom script extension.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the examples below for complete samples of configuring applications on a VM using custom script extension.
